tips.tip: Drag while holding the right mouse button to look around
Hold [Shift] while looking around to move the view up, down, left or right
Press a/A to adjust the simulation speed
Press x/X to zoom in and out
Find frequencies of nearby ATC services from the Radios dialog
Press v to change your viewpoint, Ctrl-V to return to the cockpit
Press F3 to take a screenshot
Join the FlightGear community at http://forum.flightgear.org
Press h to bring up a Heads Up Display
Show or hide the menu bar by pressing F10
Frame-rate too low? - try disabling AI traffic
Select Environment → Weather to fly in different weather
Press F12 to change the radio frequencies easily
Look around by holding down the right mouse button and moving the mouse
Select Multiplayer → Multiplayer Settings to join the shared flight environment
Can't get the engine started? - see Help → Aircraft Checklists
Drag while holding the middle and right mouse buttons to move the viewpoint
Press / to explore the internals of the simulator
Press Tab to move the viewpoint with your mouse and use the scroll wheel to zoom

menu.name: * Traffic, # departing runway (. Remaining in the pattern.
* Traffic, # departing runway (. Departing the pattern to the North.
* Traffic, # departing runway (. Departing the pattern to the East.
* Traffic, # departing runway (. Departing the pattern to the South.
* Traffic, # departing runway (. Departing the pattern to the West.
* UNICOM, # ^ miles ! descending through $ feet, inbound to enter the traffic pattern.
* Tower, # $ feet ^ miles ! of * inbound for visual approach.
* Tower, # $ feet ^ miles ! of * to transition your airspace.
* Tower, # ready to taxi, VFR North.
* Tower, # ready to taxi, VFR East.
* Tower, # ready to taxi, VFR South.
* Tower, # ready to taxi, VFR West.
* Ground, # request progressive taxi instructions to transient parking.
* Ground, # request progressive taxi instructions to the terminal.
* Ground, # ready to taxi, VFR North.
* Ground, # ready to taxi, VFR East.
* Ground, # ready to taxi, VFR South.
* Ground, # ready to taxi, VFR West.
* Approach, #, %, ^ miles ! of *, request VFR flight following.

binding.script: setprop("/nasal/tutorial/enabled",1); # load module on demand tutorial.dialog();

item.label: Show Citation II wiki page in browser

sim.author: Curt Olson - Syd Adams - Ludovic Brenta - chris_blues - Sascha Reißner

state.name: parking
state.description:
You will start the sim on the tarmac cold and dark. You will need to go through all checklists to ensure everything is running fine. Make sure you select a parking spot instead of a runway!
Start this state with --state=parking

state.name: taxi
state.description:
You will start the sim on the tarmac. All systems are go and you are ready to taxi to the active runway. Make sure you select a parking spot instead of a runway!
Start this state with --state=taxi

state.name: take-off
state.description:
You will start the sim in a take-off configuration. Flaps set, engines running. The only thing left to do is get the take-off clearance from ATC, so you can throttle up and go! Make sure you select a runway instead of a parking spot!
Start this state with --state=take-off

state.name: cruise
state.description:
You will start the sim on cruise level, FL 360 with autopilot engaged, set to "autothrottle" "true heading" "altitude hold"
Start this state with --state=cruise
If you're starting via the QTlauncher, you won't need extra options. Options needed for other launchers: --in-air

state.name: approach
state.description:
You will start the sim on glide-slope, with flaps APP configuration and gear down, autopilot off. If you provide the correct frequency for an ILS via --nav1=179:110.3 for example, where 179 is the radial and 110.3 the frequency, the ILS will be already tuned in when you enter the cockpit.
Start this state with --state=approach
If you're starting via the QTlauncher, you won't need extra options. Just tick the checkbox "on approach".
Options needed for other launchers: --glideslope=3.0 --offset-distance=10.0 --in-air
optional: --nav1=179:110.30

help.title: Cessna 550 Citation-II
help.line: Many features require power to operate. Make sure at least battery is switched on!
help.text:
Ground Proximity Warning System: Use circuit breaker 'GROUND PROXI' on right circuit breaker panel to switch off warnings.
Autopilot operation: Autopilot will disengage below decision height or 500ft above ground, whichever is highest.
FD OFF: Illuminated=OFF. Engage wing leveler and pitch hold HDG: Follow heading bug NAV: Cycle between wing leveler, NAV1 or NAV2, and GPS APR: NAV1 lateral and glideslope BC: Backcourse NAV/HSI: Toggle the HSI and autopilot between NAV1 and NAV2 ALT: Altitude hold ALT SEL: (inoperative) VNAV: (inoperative) V/S: Hold vertical speed IAS: Autothrottle to hold current indicated airspeed (use ASI-knob to change speed) PITCH wheel: Adjust pitch, selected altitude or vertical speed
---------------------------------------------------
To fold / unfold the passenger's tables, left or middle click respectively, holding the button down as long as necessary to fold the elements. To stow and unstow the folded table, left or middle-click on the cupholders.

key.desc: elevator up or increase AP altitude
key.name: 2/Down

key.desc: move aileron left or adj. AP hdg.
key.name: 4/Left

key.desc: move aileron right or adj. AP hdg.
key.name: 6/Right

key.desc: elevator down or decrease AP altitude
key.name: 8/Up

item.name: Increase throttle SLOWLY to maintain n2=

tutorial.name: Citation II - startup tutorial
tutorial.description: Learn how to start the engines and how to setup the systems for take off.

error.message: Put the battery bus switch in the up position! Left click or mouse wheel!

step.message: First, you need to check if you have enough fuel! Open the menu, choose Citation-II, then "Fuel and Payload" - and set your desired fuel and weights.
Switch on the beacon light! (the beacon should always be active if there is a running engine)
Pull the detent on right throttle lever!
Push the right throttle forward to idle position!
After right starter extinguished, switch on the right generator!
Now activate the right engine generator!
Set the voltage selector to RH GEN (use mouse-wheel)
If the voltmeter shows about 28V, you can go on with the checklist.
Now the left engine! Pull the detent on left throttle lever!
Push the left throttle forward to idle position!
After left starter extinguished, switch on the left generator!
Now activate the left engine generator!
Set the voltage selector to LH GEN (use mouse-wheel)
If the voltmeter shows about 28V, you can go on with the checklist.
Well done! Both engines are running.
Set altimeter QNH from latest METAR. (%.2f)
Switch on the left landing light!
Switch on the right landing light!
Set flaps to TO & APP. Use 3 times the ] key. (3 times [ to set flaps up again.)
Set initial cruise altitude to 33000. (43000 on the Sierra Super II)

end.message: Both engines are running and you've configured the aircraft for takeoff.

step.message: Increase throttle SLOWLY to N2 = 95.9% Press PgUp to increase throttle, PgDn to decrease throttle.
Gear up! (press key: g or middle mouse button! Key G or left mouse button brings the gear down again)
Accelerate to 180 KIAS! (Don't let the nose raise too much!)
Switch off the landing lights! ( press Ctrl + l )
Before you can engage the autopilot you need an angle of attack of less than 0.2!
Now wait until you reach 18.500 ft

end.message: Congratulations! You're on your way to FL330. Keep watching your AOA (angle of attack) and airspeed!

tutorial.name: Checklist: I - Engine startup
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the I - Engine startup checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Fuel : As required Battery : ON Beacon light : ON Left throttle lever detent : RELEASE Left engine starter : START Left engine: N2 : > 8% Left throttle : IDLE Left engine : STARTED Left engine generator : ON Right throttle lever detent : RELEASE Right engine starter : START Right engine: N2 : > 8% Right throttle : IDLE Right engine : STARTED Right engine generator : ON Avionics switch : ON

tutorial.name: Checklist: II - Before takeoff
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the II - Before takeoff checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Altimeter QNH : SET Spoilers : RETRACTED Beacon light : ON Anticollision light : ON Nav light : ON Left landing light : ON Right landing light : ON Flaps : TAKEOFF Initial cruise altitude (Citation II) : 33000 Cruise altitude (Super II) : 43000

tutorial.name: Checklist: III - Takeoff

step.message: Increase throttle SLOWLY to maintain n2= : 95.9

tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the III - Takeoff checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Parking brake : RELEASED Increase throttle SLOWLY to n2= : 95.9 Increase throttle SLOWLY to maintain n2= : 95.9 Rotate at : 130 KIAS Liftoff at : 140 KIAS Gear : UP Accelerate to : 180 KIAS Flaps : UP Level off at : 6000 ft AGL Left landing light : OFF Right landing light : OFF Accelerate to : 250 KIAS Angle of attack : < 0.2 Autopilot : ENGAGED ALT mode : ENGAGED

tutorial.name: Checklist: IV - Initial Climb
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the IV - Initial Climb checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Indicated airspeed : < 250 kts Indicated altitude : < 10000 ft Autopilot bank angle : LOW Throttle : FULL Indicated airspeed : unlimited Indicated altitude : 18500 ft Altimeter : 101.325 kPa

tutorial.name: Checklist: V - Stepped Climb (Citation II only)

step.message: Checklist: V - Stepped Climb (Citation II only)

tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the V - Stepped Climb (Citation II only) checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Climb to and hold : 33000 ft Accelerate until angle of attack : < .3 Climb to and hold : 36000 ft Accelerate until angle of attack : < .3 Climb to and hold : 39000 ft Accelerate until angle of attack : < .3 Climb to and hold : 42000 ft Accelerate until angle of attack : < .3

sim.long-description:
The Cessna 550/551 Citation II is a light corporate jet built between 1978 and 2006. The FlightGear model is a luxury corporate jet for two pilots and seven passengers. The cabin features a lavatory for long flights. At full takeoff weight, typical cruise speed is 330 KTAS at FL370; range is 1900 nmi.
The Cessna 550 requires two pilots; the 551 is the same aircraft certified for single-pilot use.
Later variants of this aircraft include the Cessna Citation Bravo, which has newer avionics (available separately in FlightGear), the Cessna Citation S/II with improved wings (not currently available in FlightGear), and the Sierra Super II, available together with this aircraft in FlightGear.

fr.long-description:
Le Cessna 550/551 Citation II est un jet d'affaires léger construit entre 1978 et 2006. Dans FlightGear, il est aménagé luxueusement pour deux pilotes et sept passagers. Il y a des toilettes à l'arrière de la cabine pour les longs vols. Après un décollage à la masse maximale autorisée, la vitesse de croisière habituelle est de 330 noeuds au FL370; le rayon d'action est de 1900 nautiques.
Le Cessna 550 requiert deux pilotes; le 551 est le même avion mais certifié pour un seul pilote.
Certaines variantes de cet appareil sont apparues: le Cessna Citation Bravo (disponible séparément dans FlightGear), le Cessna Citation S/II avec une voilure améliorée (non disponible dans FlightGear), et le Sierra Super II, livré dans FlightGear avec cet avion.

de.long-description:
Die Cessna 550/551 Citation II ist ein leichtes Geschäfts- flugzeug, daß zwischen 1978 und 2006 gebaut wurde. Das FlightGear Modell ist ein Luxusgeschäftsflugzeug für zwei Piloten und sieben Passagiere. Die Kabine hat für lange Flüge eine Toilette. Bei vollem Startgewicht beträgt die typische Reisegschwindigkeit 330 KTAS bei FL370; die Reichweite beträgt 1900 nautische Meilen.
Die Cessna 550 benötigt 2 Piloten; die 551 ist das selbe Flugzeug, zertifiziert für einen Piloten.
Spätere Varianten dieses Flugzeugs sind z.Bsp. die Citation Bravo, welche neuere Fluginstrumente enthält (für FlightGear erhältlich), die Cessna Citation S/II mit verbesserten Flügeln (nicht verfügbar für FlightGear), und die Sierra Super II, verfügbar für FlightGear mit diesem Flugzeug.

binding.script: setprop("/nasal/tutorial/enabled",1); # load module on demand tutorial.dialog();
setprop("/nasal/tutorial/enabled",1); # load module on demand tutorial.dialog();

scenario.name: Live data
scenario.description: Fetch live weather data for your nearest airport from noaa.gov. You need a working internet connection. Weather is generated automatically, once a valid METAR is received.

scenario.name: Manual input
scenario.description: Enter your favorite METAR weather. A valid METAR syntax is required.

scenario.name: Core high pressure region
scenario.description: The center of a high pressure region, characterized by descending air and hence only weak cloud development with high visibility.

scenario.name: High pressure region
scenario.description: A high pressure region, characterized my moderate to strong Cumulus development in the afternoon and fairly good visibility conditions.

scenario.name: Border of a high pressure region
scenario.description: The border of a high pressure region, in which the airmass becomes unstable and various convective and stratiform clouds may appear.

scenario.name: Border of a low pressure region
scenario.metar: XXXX 012345Z 15003KT 9SM BKN028 SCT090 FEW160 15/08 Q1010 NOSIG
scenario.description: The border of a low pressure region, in which the airmass is unstable and convective clouds start to form layers and merge into stratiform clouds.

scenario.name: Low pressure region
scenario.metar: XXXX 012345Z 15003KT 6SM SHRA BKN024 BKN053 FEW090 13/07 Q1004 NOSIG
scenario.description: A low pressure region, characterized by rising air, widespread formation of stratiform clouds and beginning rain.

scenario.name: Core low pressure region
scenario.metar: XXXX 012345Z 15003KT 4SM RA OVC020 SCT050 07/02 Q0998 NOSIG
scenario.description: The core of a low pressure region, characterized by overcast clouds, bad visibility on the ground and significant rainfall.

scenario.name: Warm sector
scenario.description: A warm sector, characterized by high moisture in the air and haze extending up to high altitudes, but otherwise largely convective cloud development.

scenario.name: Fair weather
scenario.description: A lovely day for trip to your favorite 100$ hamburger airfield

scenario.name: Thunderstorm
scenario.description: A hot and damp summer day with thunderstorms developing in the afternoon. Be prepared for reduction of visibility in showers and strong gusts near thunderstorms

scenario.name: Stormy Monday
scenario.description: You're out for an adventure? Gusty winds blowing from the west and isolated thunderstorms should be avoided. Fasten your seatbelt!

scenario.name: Marginal VFR
scenario.description: After the storm - limited visibility and some showers. Go or No-Go?

scenario.name: CAT I minimum
scenario.description: If you just got your IFR rating, this is what you are allowed to do. But can you?

scenario.name: CAT II minimum
scenario.description: With just a 1/4 mile visibility and clouds at 100ft, you don't see much of the runway until seconds before touchdown. Trust your instruments to stay alive.

scenario.name: CAT IIIb minimum
scenario.metar: XXXX 012345Z VRB01KT 0100 -RA FG OVC001 OVC002 02/02 Q0990
scenario.description: This is expert level. You will barely see the taxiway from the cockpit, even if you are on ground. Fog and light drizzle, freezing level at 1000ft.

scenario.name: Early morning fog
scenario.description: Fog developed this autumn's morning. Expect good visibility above the layer. However - getting through it can be a challenge. Stay alive for a 500' climb and you'll see the sun!

comm.atis: Honolulu Intl airport information alpha. two three two zero zulu. Winned one five zero at three. Visibility one zero. few seven thousand two hundret, few three five thousand .. Temperature two five, dewpoint seven. Altimeter three zero three six. i l s approach runway zero eight is in use. Departure runway zero eight .. Advise on initial contact you have information alpha..

key.desc: Display a dialog relevant to the tuned in ATC service (if any)
Elevator up or increase autopilot altitude
Move aileron left (or adjust AP heading.)
Move aileron right (or adjust AP heading.)
Elevator down or decrease autopilot altitude

key.name: B
key.desc: Toggle parking brake on or off

key.name: I
key.desc: Switch to and toggle alternative HUD types

key.name: p
key.desc: Toggle the pause state of the sim

key.name: Left
key.desc: Move aileron left (or adjust AP heading.)

key.name: Up
key.desc: Elevator down or decrease autopilot altitude

key.name: Right
key.desc: Move aileron right (or adjust AP heading.)

key.name: Down
key.desc: Elevator up or increase autopilot altitude

binding.script: var command = sprintf("@delete%d", arg[0] > 0 ? arg[0] - 1 : 0); setprop("/autopilot/route-manager/input", command);
var command = sprintf("@insert%d:%s", arg[0] > 0 ? arg[0] - 1 : 0, arg[1]); setprop("/autopilot/route-manager/input", command);

FD OFF: Illuminated=OFF. Engage wing leveler and pitch hold HDG: Follow heading bug NAV: Cycle between wing leveler, NAV1 or NAV2, and GPS APR: NAV1 lateral and glideslope BC: Backcourse NAV/HSI: Toggle the HSI and autopilot between NAV1 and NAV2 ALT: Altitude hold ALT SEL: (inoperative) VNAV: (inoperative) V/S: Hold vertical speed IAS: Autothrottle to hold current indicated airspeed (use ASI-knob to change speed) PITCH wheel: Adjust pitch, selected altitude or vertical speed

tutorial.name: Citation II - startup tutorial
tutorial.description: Learn how to start the engines and how to setup the systems for take off.

error.message: Put the battery bus switch in the up position! Left click or mouse wheel!

step.message: First, you need to check if you have enough fuel! Open the menu, choose Citation-II, then "Fuel and Payload" - and set your desired fuel and weights.
Switch on the beacon light! (the beacon should always be active if there is a running engine)
Pull the detent on right throttle lever!
Push the right throttle forward to idle position!
After right starter extinguished, switch on the right generator!
Now activate the right engine generator!
Set the voltage selector to RH GEN (use mouse-wheel)
If the voltmeter shows about 28V, you can go on with the checklist.
Now the left engine! Pull the detent on left throttle lever!
Push the left throttle forward to idle position!
After left starter extinguished, switch on the left generator!
Now activate the left engine generator!
Set the voltage selector to LH GEN (use mouse-wheel)
If the voltmeter shows about 28V, you can go on with the checklist.
Well done! Both engines are running.
Set altimeter QNH from latest METAR. (%.2f)
Switch on the left landing light!
Switch on the right landing light!
Set flaps to TO & APP. Use 3 times the ] key. (3 times [ to set flaps up again.)
Set initial cruise altitude to 33000. (43000 on the Sierra Super II)

end.message: Both engines are running and you've configured the aircraft for takeoff.

step.message: Increase throttle SLOWLY to N2 = 95.9% Press PgUp to increase throttle, PgDn to decrease throttle.
Gear up! (press key: g or middle mouse button! Key G or left mouse button brings the gear down again)
Accelerate to 180 KIAS! (Don't let the nose raise too much!)
Switch off the landing lights! ( press Ctrl + l )
Before you can engage the autopilot you need an angle of attack of less than 0.2!
Now wait until you reach 18.500 ft

end.message: Congratulations! You're on your way to FL330. Keep watching your AOA (angle of attack) and airspeed!

tutorial.name: Checklist: I - Engine startup
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the I - Engine startup checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Fuel : As required Battery : ON Beacon light : ON Left throttle lever detent : RELEASE Left engine starter : START Left engine: N2 : > 8% Left throttle : IDLE Left engine : STARTED Left engine generator : ON Right throttle lever detent : RELEASE Right engine starter : START Right engine: N2 : > 8% Right throttle : IDLE Right engine : STARTED Right engine generator : ON Avionics switch : ON

tutorial.name: Checklist: II - Before takeoff
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the II - Before takeoff checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Altimeter QNH : SET Spoilers : RETRACTED Beacon light : ON Anticollision light : ON Nav light : ON Left landing light : ON Right landing light : ON Flaps : TAKEOFF Initial cruise altitude (Citation II) : 33000 Cruise altitude (Super II) : 43000

tutorial.name: Checklist: III - Takeoff

step.message: Increase throttle SLOWLY to maintain n2= : 95.9

tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the III - Takeoff checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Parking brake : RELEASED Increase throttle SLOWLY to n2= : 95.9 Increase throttle SLOWLY to maintain n2= : 95.9 Rotate at : 130 KIAS Liftoff at : 140 KIAS Gear : UP Accelerate to : 180 KIAS Flaps : UP Level off at : 6000 ft AGL Left landing light : OFF Right landing light : OFF Accelerate to : 250 KIAS Angle of attack : < 0.2 Autopilot : ENGAGED ALT mode : ENGAGED

tutorial.name: Checklist: IV - Initial Climb
tutorial.description:
Tutorial to run through the IV - Initial Climb checklist.
Checklist available through the Help->Checklists menu.
Indicated airspeed : < 250 kts Indicated altitude : < 10000 ft Autopilot bank angle : LOW Throttle : FULL Indicated airspeed : unlimited Indicated altitude : 18500 ft Altimeter : 101.325 kPa

Tutorial to run through the V - Stepped Climb (Citation II only) checklist.

PropertyList.long-description:
The Cessna 550/551 Citation II is a light corporate jet built between 1978 and 2006. The FlightGear model is a luxury corporate jet for two pilots and seven passengers. The cabin features a lavatory for long flights. At full takeoff weight, typical cruise speed is 330 KTAS at FL370; range is 1900 nmi.
The Cessna 550 requires two pilots; the 551 is the same aircraft certified for single-pilot use.
Later variants of this aircraft include the Cessna Citation Bravo, which has newer avionics (available separately in FlightGear), the Cessna Citation S/II with improved wings (not currently available in FlightGear), and the Sierra Super II, available together with this aircraft in FlightGear.

fr.long-description:
Le Cessna 550/551 Citation II est un jet d'affaires léger construit entre 1978 et 2006. Dans FlightGear, il est aménagé luxueusement pour deux pilotes et sept passagers. Il y a des toilettes à l'arrière de la cabine pour les longs vols. Après un décollage à la masse maximale autorisée, la vitesse de croisière habituelle est de 330 noeuds au FL370; le rayon d'action est de 1900 nautiques.
Le Cessna 550 requiert deux pilotes; le 551 est le même avion mais certifié pour un seul pilote.
Certaines variantes de cet appareil sont apparues: le Cessna Citation Bravo (disponible séparément dans FlightGear), le Cessna Citation S/II avec une voilure améliorée (non disponible dans FlightGear), et le Sierra Super II, livré dans FlightGear avec cet avion.

de.long-description:
Die Cessna 550/551 Citation II ist ein leichtes Geschäfts- flugzeug, daß zwischen 1978 und 2006 gebaut wurde. Das FlightGear Modell ist ein Luxusgeschäftsflugzeug für zwei Piloten und sieben Passagiere. Die Kabine hat für lange Flüge eine Toilette. Bei vollem Startgewicht beträgt die typische Reisegschwindigkeit 330 KTAS bei FL370; die Reichweite beträgt 1900 nautische Meilen.
Die Cessna 550 benötigt 2 Piloten; die 551 ist das selbe Flugzeug, zertifiziert für einen Piloten.
Spätere Varianten dieses Flugzeugs sind z.Bsp. die Citation Bravo, welche neuere Fluginstrumente enthält (für FlightGear erhältlich), die Cessna Citation S/II mit verbesserten Flügeln (nicht verfügbar für FlightGear), und die Sierra Super II, verfügbar für FlightGear mit diesem Flugzeug.

messages.copilot: Welcome aboard! Need help? Use 'Help -> Tutorials'.

binding.script: setprop("/nasal/tutorial/enabled",1); # load module on demand tutorial.dialog();
